articles.author: Jack Queen, Jody Godoy, Andy Sullivan
articles.description: Former National Enquirer publisher David Pecker will answer more questions about his efforts to suppress damaging information about Donald Trump during the 2016 election, as the former president's criminal hush-money trial continues on Friday.
articles.title: Former tabloid publisher to face more questions in Trump hush-money trial

articles.author: Julia Harte, Kia Johnson
articles.description: Columbia's embattled president came under renewed pressure on Friday as a university oversight committee met to address her attempt two weeks ago to clamp down on protests that have roiled the Ivy League school and spread across the country and aboard.
articles.title: Columbia University president faces vote of confidence as protests spread

articles.author: Brendan O'Brien
articles.description: Ohio police released video of a Black man who died at a local hospital after repeatedly telling officers "I can't breathe" as they pinned him to the floor of a bar and handcuffed him, evoking memories of the killing of George Floyd in 2020.
articles.title: 'I can't breathe': Black man in Ohio tells police before he died, video shows

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Hamas said it had received on Saturday Israel's official response to its latest ceasefire proposal and will study it before submitting its reply, the group's deputy Gaza chief said in a statement.
articles.title: Hamas says it received Israel's response to its ceasefire proposal

articles.author: Julie Steenhuysen, Tom Polansek
articles.description: One in five commercial milk samples tested in a nationwide survey contained particles of the H5N1 virus, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration said late on Thursday, suggesting the outbreak of bird flu is more widespread than previously thought.
articles.title: Bird flu: one in five US commercial milk samples contain traces, says FDA

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippines on Saturday denied a Chinese claim that the two countries had reached an agreement over an escalating maritime dispute in the South China Sea, calling the claim propaganda.
articles.title: Philippines denies deal with China over disputed South China Sea shoal

articles.author: Michael Holden
articles.description: Britain's King Charles will return to public duties next week for the first time since being diagnosed with cancer as he makes good progress following treatment and a period of recuperation, Buckingham Palace said on Friday.
articles.title: King Charles to resume public duties after cancer diagnosis

articles.author: Dhanya Skariachan, Chris Thomas, Nikunj Ohri
articles.description: India began voting on Friday in the second phase of the world's biggest election, as Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his rivals raise the pitch of the campaign by focusing on hot-button issues such as religious discrimination, affirmative action and taxes.
articles.title: India begins voting in second phase of giant election as Modi vs Gandhi campaign heats up

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli strike in Lebanon's Beqaa region has killed two members of a Lebanese militant group that has fired rockets across the southern border at Israel, the group said on Friday.
articles.title: Israeli strike kills Lebanese militants in Beqaa area

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Aid shipments to Gaza from Cyprus resumed late on Friday, a Cypriot source said, with a ship carrying food to the besieged Palestinian enclave after a pause following Israel's killing of seven aid workers.
articles.title: Gaza aid from Cyprus resumes after pause following aid worker killings, source says
